title: The Round C
content:
Hi-  
I am looking for this font - I love the extra round C. This is a sign on a building here (thus the shadow it has cast on the wall).

Any input for this font or similar, with very round Cs and Os would be much appreciated.  
Isabella

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022717im_/http:/typophile.com/files/COC-Building_4547.jpg)

 [‹ What is this rounded type ?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022717/http:/typophile.com/node/49644 "Go to previous forum topic") [What's the typophile heading font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022717/http:/typophile.com/node/49873 "Go to next forum topic")
author: izzyce

comments.content: This is probably custom industrial lettering, the kind off of which [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022717/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100008) is based.

Other round Cs and Os:

[Neuzeit Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022717/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/urw/neuzeit_grotesk/?sample_text=CONCORD&sample_size=60)  
 [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022717/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mark_simonson/proxima_nova/?sample_text=CONCORD&sample_size=60)  
 [FF Super Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022717/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_super_grotesk_ot_medium/?sample_text=CONCORD&sample_size=60)  
 [Drescher Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022717/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/bitstream/drescher_grotesk_demi_ot/?sample_text=CONCORD&sample_size=60)  
 [Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081102022717/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/century_gothic_std_vp/?sample_text=CONCORD&sample_size=60)

I adore Gotham. I wish there was a way to test drive fonts in a more user-friendly manner before committing to purchasing the license... I love to support the foundries, but if I am designing a piece and don’t know if the client will love the font, it’s hard to commit financially up front.
